title: Capstone Farm Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: David Anstiss / Bridleway in Capstone Country Park
images.caption: Bridleway in the park. This bridleway leads through and on a special route around the country park. This is taken near the Orchard Car park.

images.title: David Anstiss / Visitor Centre for Capstone Country Park
images.caption: Visitor Centre for Capstone Country Park. Fishing permits to fish in the lake are obtained here, also other information about the park and events can be found here. There is also a child friendly park display inside.

images.title: David Anstiss / The Orchard Carpark in Capstone Country Park
images.caption: The Orchard Carpark in Capstone Country Park

images.title: David Anstiss / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: The Events Field. Has kite flying and other similar events throughout the year. Bluebell hill communication masts seen in background on left.

images.title: David Anstiss / Entrance to Capstone Farm Country Park
images.caption: A dog pictured at the entrance to the park. From footpath near Sharsted Cottage. Drowhill Woods seen on right-hand side. Red signs on fence show motorcycle route around Country Park. There are other separate routes for walkers, cyclists and horse-riders.

images.title: David Anstiss / Capstone Lake and Cafe
images.caption: Capstone Lake and Cafe. Fishing space seen in foreground. Many people feed the ducks during the day, from the steps seen in the photo

images.title: David Anstiss / Walkway / Bridge over Capstone Lake
images.caption: Walkway / Bridge over Capstone Lake Walkway heads on left towards the Cafe, going right leads to a circular walk around the lake. The reeds in the foreground are a big breeding habitat for frogs in the spring.

description: Enjoy several cycling and walking trails in this delightful country park near Gillingham. The park is located in the beautiful North Downs with ancient woodlands, old orchards, a freshwater lake and wildflower meadows to explore. There's excellent facilities with a Visitor Centre, cafe and picnic areas. You can extend the walk by heading south along public footpaths which will take you to Hook Wood, near Lidsing.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a nice on site cafe overlooking the lake where you can enjoy refreshments after your exercise.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: With parkland and woodland trails the park is very popular with dog walkers so you're bound to see other dogs on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A couple of miles south west of the park you can visit the Medway Megaliths. Here you can explore a series of early Neolithic chambered long barrows and megalithic monuments located in the lower valley of the River Medway. You can also climb to a splendid North Downs viewpoint at Blue Bell Hill near here. Two long distance trails pass near to the ancient site in the shape of the North Downs Way and the Pilgrims Way. Both of these waymarked paths provide and opportunity for further exploring the surrounding countryside. For more walking ideas in the area see the Kent Walks and North Downs Walks pages.

display_address: Capstone Farm Country Park, Capstone Road, Capstone, Chatham, Medway, England, ME7 3QF, United Kingdom
